metadata.Title: CVE-2016-2051 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Multiple unspecified vulnerabilities in Google V8 before 4.8.271.17, as used in Google Chrome before 48.0.2564.82, allow attackers to cause a denial of service or possibly have other impact via unknown vectors.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-2051` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 48.0.2564.82-0ubuntu1.1222
chromium-browser-l10n - 48.0.2564.82-0ubuntu1.1222
chromium-chromedriver - 48.0.2564.82-0ubuntu1.1222
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 48.0.2564.82-0ubuntu1.1222
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 48.0.2564.82-0ubuntu1.1222
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: mikesalvatore> The Ubuntu Security Team does not support libv8

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '48.0.2564.82-0ubuntu1.1222').
libv8-3.14: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'libv8 not supported').
